CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper February 24, 1945, pg. 11, reads: "Heart Formal - Miss Mabel Jackson and Miss Eugenia Ford were honored by the Qui Vives at a Heart Formal, last Wednesday night. Len Gloster and his Esquires of Rhythm supplied the music. Standing, left to right: Ruth Mack, Jean Glenn, Christine Norwood, Izetta Woodson, Betty Burwell, Betty Lee, Jaque Tinker, Vietta Jones, Lula Mosley, Julia Carter, Irene Cleveland, Ethel Childs, Frances Russell, Dolores Haywood. Seated are Eugenia Ford, Edith Holmes, president, and Mabel Jackson. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Eugenia Ford, Edith Holmes and Mabel Jackson seated in front of Ruth Mack, Jean Glenn, Christine Norwood, Izetta Woodson, Betty Burwell, Betty Lee, Jaque Tinker, Vietta Jones, Lula Mosley, Julia Carter, Irene Cleveland, Ethel Childs, Frances Russell, and Dolores Haywood for Qui Vives Heart Formal
